message: I'm curious too see what they do with the iPhone 5.  I'm guessing it will be more of a revision being that the iPhone 4 was a bit change from the 3G/3GS.
Well.. not excited about any of them.. the scene is kind of set in my mind now.
iphone 5 but i hope it is just hardware update since i have the iphone 4 and i don't want to break the contract otherwise if it is a big update i will be paying that money to get it
Probably the EVO since I'm looking to go to Sprint this fall when my TMobile contract runs out.
iPhone 5. Not at all interested in 3D anything.
If the iPhone had support for Google apps (Gmail, Google Calendar, et al) I'd really want one. As it stands, neither. I don't want 3D anything...
LG Optimus 2x for me! I don't need no 3D nor do I want any of that Apple crap ;-)
I always associate LG with refrigerators.
@spencer Yeah I am not the biggest fan too but the phone appears to be pretty nice (dual-core) and stock Android
@cym0n Specs don't mean anything to me as long as the user experience feels great. So, iPhone all the way, for now.
@spencer Agreed, I love the stock Android user experience so it works for me

actually just came from the sprint store, they will give new sprint costumers $125 for there next bill just for switching from AT&T,and if you trade in your iphone you get $250 off the phone purchase ,that means free EVO 3D plus extra money for accesories.
Not too shabby! Wish Verizon was running deals like that.
